The New York Yankees are giving the ball to Roger Clemens in hopes that he will turn things around against the Cleveland Indians. 
 
 "I've got to go out and be aggressive," said the 45-year-old Clemens. "What I lack in stuff, I'll throw my heart out there, like I always have. I've got a lot of will and desire -- doesn't matter my age. I draw on a lot of energy. You know, if my body feels good or bad, I don't worry about it."

 I guess all those years of heavy steroid use have finally caught up to ol' Roger. He can't get it done anymore.
 
 Bye Bye Yankees. emoticon_xbye emoticon_xbye :p :p
 
 Waxy

The Yankees will return in 2008.
